You know...
 
 It seems to me a quite dreadful affair
 To have ones mind take to such disrepair
 As to think-
 When I drink-
 In the depths of the night
 That I ever could give up the day job and write
 Or could manage the leap back from fire to pan
 And yet when I began... 
 
 I thought otherwise then
 So I took up my pen
 And with treacherous confidence pressed it again
 To the page I had bested so often before
 And with Albeniz plucking a musical score
 I compelled it to travel
 The plot to unravel
 With words to bedazzle as never before!
 
 But...
 
 Perhaps it was genius courting my ear
 That inspired uncertainty, nervousness, fear
 Or perhaps it was simply the blank of the page
 That defeated my sage
 I confess at that stage
 To a kind of despair
 An ineloquent rage had me choked in its snare
 As I huddled there bathed in that pitiless glare.
 
 Now I sit as I did with my pen in my hand
 Ever ready to move at my slightest command
 Yet the page still remains 
 And the taunting refrains
 Of that damnable Albeniz circle my brains
 Shall I ever be free of their exquisite glee?
 Must I suffer possessing less talent than he?
 Will the nib of my pen yet immortalize me?

post_info.post_title: To be read at a dead run...
